title: Drawing, "Ornamental Panel", 1806
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and gray wash on three sheets of paper joined vertically, lined with cardboard
signed: Signed in pen and brown ink at lower left: Flaminio Minozzi 1806 / Bolognese
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Design for an ornamental panel.  Horizontal design with Acanthus rinceau/scrolls, the stem being held by a satyr, situated at the left side of the sheet. The pattern terminates at right with a scroll, touched by a female figure with fishtail legs and a plant sprouting from her head.  Intended to be the center of the entire frieze.  Three putti and a bird placed in the areas free of the Acanthus motif.  Framed on all sides.  Signed at the lower left corner.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Ornamental Panel", 1806.
1806. Pen and brown ink, brush and gray wash on three sheets of paper joined vertically, lined with cardboard. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-7206.
